name: ISM_TRANSITION
title: ISM_TRANSITION
description: Model of a transition in the Instruction State Machine, caused by a careflow step. The attributes document the careflow step as well as the ISM transition.

element.short: Model of a transition in the Instruction State Machine, caused by a careflow step.
element.definition: Model of a transition in the Instruction State Machine, caused by a careflow step. The attributes document the careflow step as well as the ISM transition.
The ISM current state. Coded by openEHR terminology group Instruction states.

element.short: The ISM transition which occurred to arrive in the current_state.
element.definition: The ISM transition which occurred to arrive in the current_state. Coded by openEHR terminology group  Instruction transitions.

element.short: The step in the careflow process which occurred as part of generating this action, e.
element.definition: The step in the careflow process which occurred as part of generating this action, e.g.  dispense ,  start_administration. This attribute represents the clinical  label for the activity, as  opposed to current_state which represents  the state machine (ISM)  computable form. Defined in archetype.

element.short: Optional possibility of adding one or more reasons for this careflow step having been taken.
element.definition: Optional possibility of adding one or more reasons for this careflow step having been taken. Multiple reasons may occur in medication management for example.
